COMMENT_TX: $played at the Polo Grounds, New York; originally scheduled to be played at Ebbets Field, Brooklyn, but the game was moved to allow a bigger crowd to attend because the proceeds went to  two charities related to the war effort; Managers: Joe McCarthy (AL New York), Leo Durocher (NL Brooklyn); there was a blackout test scheduled for NYC at 9:30 PM (the game finished at 9:28); the rules were changed for war: pitchers could go five innings
